ai.summary: A 7.5 km circular hike around Godinton Park in the UK, weaving through manicured parkland and shaded woodland with gentle gradients. The route is suitable for walkers with a moderate fitness level and offers varied scenery at a relaxed pace.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed surfaces including compacted gravel paths, grassy sections, and shaded woodland trails. Expect gentle slopes and some uneven ground; footwear with good grip is advised.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather conditions and daylight hours; wear sturdy footwear and bring a light rain jacket. Stay on marked paths, watch for uneven ground and wet leaves, and be mindful of other trail users. Carry water, a basic map or GPS, and a means to contact someone in case of emergency. Keep dogs under control and be prepared for seasonal changes in trail conditions.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking shoes or boots with good grip
Lightweight rain cover or packable rain jacket
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April to October) for the best conditions; in colder months ensure proper footwear and warm clothing for variable UK weather.
